result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek A. Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with victim R.M. unless approved by both R.M. and DOC.
Complete a domestic violence intervention program recommended by DOC. Take all medications as prescribed.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:41 PM Defendant Derek A. Dixon in court in person and in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald in person.  David S Olson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders sentence withheld 4 years probation consecutive to count 5 in 22CF29.  As conditions of probation, defendant is to complete a domestic violence intervention program recommended by DOC and complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. No contact with victim R.M. unless approved by both R.M. and DOC. Take all medications as prescribed. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit zero days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and arraingment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:09 AM Defendant Derek A. Dixon in court in custody by video with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
